words.etymology_text: From Proto-Finnic *ujudak. Cognate with Estonian ujuma (“to swim”). Analyzable as ui- + -ua.

glosses: unabashed

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

glosses: negative participle of ujostella

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

examples.text: Luulen, että voin ujuttaa itseni tästä läpi, mutta se tekee tiukkaa.
examples.english: I think I can thread my way through here, but it’s going to be tight.

glosses: Used to describe gradual and sometimes secretive movement towards an objective.
to thread (to pass through a narrow constriction or around a series of obstacles)

examples.english: They coaxed the rope through the pipe.

glosses: Used to describe gradual and sometimes secretive movement towards an objective.
to coax (to carefully manipulate into a particular desired state, situation or position)

examples.text: Poika ujutti kättään kohti tytön polvea.
examples.english: The boy inched his hand toward the girl's knee.

glosses: Used to describe gradual and sometimes secretive movement towards an objective.
to inch (to advance very slowly, or by a small amount at a time)

examples.text: Tämä on vain yritys ujuttaa oikeistolaista propagandaa opetusmateriaalin osaksi.
examples.english: This is just an attempt to foist right-wing propaganda as part of teaching materials.

glosses: Used to describe gradual and sometimes secretive movement towards an objective.
to foist (to introduce or insert surreptitiously or without warrant)

examples.text: Ase ei ole minun. Oikea murhaaja on ujuttanut sen laukkuuni.
examples.english: That gun's not mine. It was planted in my bag by the real murderer.

glosses: Used to describe gradual and sometimes secretive movement towards an objective.
to plant (to place an object somewhere, often with the implication of intending deceit)
shy, coy, timid

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.
